meanings.definition: To make something resemble or conform to the principles or practices of Nazism.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was nazifying the classroom by displaying propaganda posters.
meanings.sent2: The extremist group was nazifying innocent minds with their hateful ideology.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully pretended they were nazifying their clubhouse with strict rules.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds nazifying the sky foretold an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes were nazifying the canvas with symbols of oppression.

meanings.definition: To subject to the influence or control of Nazism.
meanings.sent1: The dictator was nazifying the country, imposing strict laws on its citizens.
meanings.sent2: During the war, many countries were nazifying their occupied territories.
meanings.sent3: The prankster joked about nazifying the cafeteria with a new menu of dictator specials.
meanings.sent4: The oppressive regime was slowly nazifying every aspect of daily life.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the room felt like it was nazifying everyone present.
